name: Music is Healing! Sing a Song, Play Guitar-Music to Make a Difference!
requirements: One Hour a Month at Your Convenience
description: Volunteers gifted with musical talent and song are needed-Guitarist and Inspirational Songs & Hymns at Special Request for Hospice Patients Provide love, solace, comfort, & joy with your gift and help bring music back into our patient's heart and life. Volunteers visit patient & loved ones in the home -porch music is a favorite! This is a great opportunity to share your talent and encourage others to make a joyful noise! Opportunities in Greenville/Simpsonville area

name: Volunteer Client Service Representative
requirements: Must be able to work a computer and do data entry.  Must be friendly and caring to the public.
description: We are Christian HELP and every day we help everyday people connect with the skills, work, and resources they need to bridge the gap between what they earn and what they need so they do not become homeless. We do this with caring excellence in a relational way that imparts dignity, respect, and hope for a better future for everyone. The ideal volunteer for this position has a heart for Christian service and the desire and skills to accurately connect people with programs that sustain and improve lives. Coordinate the entry of clients into Christian HELP Pantry and Resource programs using distinctive Christian HELP care and values, imparting dignity, and respect for all, with a great desire to be helpful. Training Christian HELP Headquarters, 450 Seminola Blvd. Casselberry, FL 32707 Part Time Position - 9:00am - 1:00pm M-F

name: Special Events Volunteering
requirements: This is a Done in a Day opportunity and there is no prior training or ongoing commitment needed.
We have volunteer needs for weekly Women's Programs that are consultation based volunteer efforts in our Dress for Success boutique. We also have volunteer needs for events throughout the year.
description: EmBe holds special events each year as fundraising, awareness raising, and to promote and celebrate women and families throughout the Sioux Falls area. We would welcome your help and expertise at our events, serving on a committee, helping plan an event or a portion of an event, preparation and/or set up for an event, help on-site at the event or in other ways that your time and talents allow! Events include: The EMBES - our annual awards program and largest fundraiser, In Her Shoes Empowerment Breakfast benefiting Dress for Success Sioux Falls, quarterly Refresh Your Closet Sales and our Girls on the Run 5k in the fall and spring.

name: Want to volunteer ONE day a month?  Check out the Red Shield community pantry
organizationName: The Salvation Army of Summit County
requirements: This is a Done in a Day opportunity and there is no prior training or ongoing commitment needed.
Every second Wednesday of the month (Except Dec)
Ability to lift at times (helpful),  customer service, professional attitude, and a heart to serve
description: The monthly RED SHIELD program at The Salvation Army is held at 1033 Bellows Rd in Akron. Volunteers are here for just a few hours on the 2nd Wednesday of the month (8 AM -11:30 AM). The dates for Red Shield in 2025 are: Aug 13 Sep 10th Oct 8th Nov 12th Dec 3rd Come out and help in any way you're comfortable. You can organize food, shop carts of food or be outside and help load food into the cars. Every month we make and load about 250 carts of food. The cars are lined up as much as 40 deep down the street waiting for FREE GROCERIES. Come out and be a part of this amazing community outreach! You can come alone, with your family or bring a group. The more hands the better! Contact John Kasler at The Salvation Army to volunteer through this website or by calling/texting at 330.958.2906. You may also directly reach our Volunteer portal here: https://easternusa.salvationarmy.org/northeast-ohio/summit-county/volunteer Thank you!

name: Job Fair Volunteer
requirements: This is a Done in a Day opportunity and there is no prior training or ongoing commitment needed.
There is a 3–4-hour time commitment.  Volunteers are also encouraged to serve the whole day from 9am - 4pm.
description: Principle Function: Greet job seekers as they arrive and point them in the right direction to employers. This role requires walking, standing, and assisting job seekers with a smile, while being courteous and patient. This role also requires some light set up and break down.
location: 4603 West Colonial Dr Central Florida Fairgrounds HALL C Orlando, FL 32808

name: Information Technology Support
requirements: 4 to 8 hours per week Monday-Friday between 8:30 am-4:30 pm, volunteer days are flexible.
Prefer experience supporting Microsoft networks and experience with desktop computers in a Microsoft environment. Experience in a people-to-people support role / help desk a plus!
description: Volunteers needed to support our technology infrastructure and its users. Microsoft network, desktop computers, network printers, and Microsoft software experience preferred. Tasks include equipment testing, installation, and hardware support; software testing, installation, and maintenance; and orientation and training of our users on our network and equipment. Be part of our mission of Changing & Saving Lives Through the Power of Aviation. See your work making a positive impact on people's lives. Experience the camaraderie of being a member of the Wings of Hope family, a dedicated group of individuals committed to serving others, supporting each other and having fun along the way!
location: 18370 Wings of Hope Blvd Spirit of St Louis Airport Chesterfield, MO 63005

requirements: Volunteers must sign up for available shifts on our website at www.ccfoodbank.org/get-involved/volunteer.
description: The will be contributing to our emergency food relief service. Volunteers will assist clients by appointment only with an emergency meal box, a range of fresh fruit, vegetables, dry foods, and/or dairy products to their vehicles. This service aims to alleviate the pressures of accessing healthy food for clients within Central California Food Bank's service area. : 15 years or older Monday - Friday (7:30am-10:30am, and 10:30am-1:30pm)

name: Food Pantry Volunteer
description: Food Pantry Volunteers are needed  needed: Monday - Friday 8:30- 4:30. You can also serve with us from 8:30am - 12:30am or Noon - 4pm. You can help unload, sort and distribute the food to families in need. If you enjoy helping others and would like to volunteer, we need YOU!!! Christian HELP prevents homelessness by helping people find work, provide resources and offering spriritual encouragement.

name: Advocate as a Volunteer Ombudsman
requirements: An initial 36-hour certification course and monthly trainings
description: Advocate for those in long-term care. A United Way long-term care ombudsman is a trained volunteer who advocates for quality of life and care for people living in nursing homes and assisted living facilities. You’ll work with residents, families and facility staff to help ensure these residents can continue a life of dignity, respect, choice and as much independence as possible. Contact Yuri Martinez, Staff Ombudsman/Volunteer Coordinator at: yuri.martinez@unitedwaytarrant.org or 817-258-8104.
location: This is a Virtual Opportunity with no fixed address.

name: Aircraft Mechanics / Avionics Technicians
description: Aircraft Mechanic Volunteers - AMT(A&P) / IA’s, experience working on single and twin-piston engine aircraft to volunteer 1-2 days a week, during weekdays. Also looking for non-licensed but aircraft-experienced Aircraft Maintenance assistants who must have light aircraft refurbishment skill sets. Avionics Technician Volunteers - Inspects and tests aircraft avionics. Adjusts. repairs, and/or replaces components as needed. Perform Pitot-Static and Transponder checks. Be part of our mission of Changing & Saving Lives Through the Power of Aviation. See your work making a positive impact on people's lives. name: Volunteer With a Child For The Day: Make A Difference!
organizationName: Easter Seals Serving DC MD VA
requirements: You must complete required forms and have a confirmation from the respite team prior to attending the event.
description: Join Easterseals Respite Services to give parents a much-needed temporary break from day-to-day caregiving duties. In-Center Weekend Respite serves little warriors (children whose parents were injured in war) veterans, active-duty military, first responders, civilian families, and families with children with and without disabilities. These respite events take place one Saturday a month and each respite event is planned to include a different monthly theme and ensure a variety of interactive activities. The children and their paired volunteer will be able to unleash their imagination in a world of hands-on discovery with painting, drawing, sculpting, and other creative activities. As a volunteer, you will spend the day paired one-on-one with a child. Each volunteer/child match will be hand-selected based on the volunteer's and child's screening forms. Lunch and snacks are included, along with a monthly raffle. * Please note this is not a one-time commitment. We want to have established volunteers who can attend as often as they are able. If you completed an inquiry, I will send you an e-mail from mjaster@eseal.org or bkaiser@eseal.org to your personal e-mail box that you provided. Please be sure to check spam/junk folders for my email.

name: Executive Secretary
description: Whomever holds this position title is in charge of making sure all documentation and files are kept properly safe, confidential and easy to access for specific staff with specific security clearances. You are also in charge of assisting registrants with their transition and registration into one of our programs, making sure that what they’ve been signed up for that such services are being offered by the staff that are leading such program or offering service. Assuring that working physical locations are operating within protocol. And assisting executive directors in their work, schedulings of appointments, etc... Making sure that monthly payments are being met, a long with other forms of conducting communication with parents. Handling communication with law enforcement and organizations.

name: Committee Coordinator/Member - Waterbury CT
description: Join Us in Making a Difference! Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and 'Street Care'. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and we have been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile individual to join our management team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you! The Pvol will play a key role in supporting the planning, execution, and monitoring of programs. Working closely with program managers, volunteers, and stakeholders, this role is critical for ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and in alignment with our mission. Assist in the development of project plans, including setting timelines, defining deliverables, and coordinating resources. Communicate with project stakeholders, including donors, volunteers, community partners, and beneficiaries, ensuring alignment and timely updates. Prepare and maintain project documentation such as status reports, meeting minutes, and evaluation reports. Ensure compliance with funders' requirements. Recruit, train, and manage volunteers involved in project activities. Help plan and organize project-related events, such as workshops, conferences, or community outreach events. Identify potential risks to project timelines and outcomes, and propose solutions to mitigate issues. Assist with the development and implementation of tools to measure project impact and outcomes. Provide general administrative assistance to project teams, including scheduling meetings, managing communication, and handling logistics. Skills: Strong organizational and time-management skills. Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities. Budget tracking and financial management experience is a plus. Experience working with diverse communities and stakeholders. Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Networking opportunities with professionals and other volunteers in the nonprofit sector. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us For more information, please reach out to us at  info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position,  email your resume to  hrdept@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Bright Mind (https://brightmindenrichment.org/) and Street Care (https://streetcare.us/)

name: Session leader for tutoring young kids, and learn life skills - Township Library, PA
requirements: 3-4 hours per week once a week.

- Love working with young kids (K-3).
 Earned B or higher in high school math courses.
 Ages 13-18
description: Looking for leadership experience? Do you love working with kids? Do you love math? OneInMath volunteers develop valuable leadership, negotiation and management skills in a fun environment, and have the satisfaction of helping kids learn math. At OneInMath, we believe every kid should have a chance to succeed in Math! Come, be part of the movement to help kids from Kindergarten to 3rd grade to master basic arithmetic skills, so they are more successful in the future! We are looking for a Session Lead  and you have a unique opportunity to lead the program. You will be provided full support, training, and continuing mentoring to help you succeed. Specific duties of Session Lead are available at:  https://oneinmath.com/session-leader/ . To apply, please fill out the Session Lead Application at:  https://oneinmath.com/register-session-lead/ Please apply at your earliest to be considered for this role. As a session leader, you are responsible for an entire branch of OneInMath. Your duties include supervising both tutors and students. You will ensure tutors are tutoring effectively and diligently and will the ensure quality of teaching using the OneInMath curriculum and techniques. Furthermore, it is the job of the session leader to communicate with librarians, parents, and volunteers, and report to executive team. RESPONSIBILITIES
location: Township Library of Lower Southampton 1983 Bridgetown Pike Feasterville, PA 19053

name: Committee Coordinator- Centennial
description: Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and has been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile volunteer to join our team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact in the lives of those experiencing homelessness, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking dedicated and compassionate individuals to join our Street Care team as Committee Coordinator. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible difference in the lives of those experiencing homelessness. You will work closely with our Community Outreach team to provide support, resources, and advocacy for homeless individuals and families. We have decades of experience providing aid to homeless and highly at risk people, and our program always places safety first. We have a variety of openings, whether you’re interested in going out on the street or looking to help in other ways. Key Responsibilities Direct Support: Engage with homeless individuals and families to assess their needs and provide appropriate support. Distribute essential items such as food, clothing, hygiene products, and blankets. Resource Connection: Connect individuals with local services, including housing, medical care, job training, and mental health support. Provide information about available resources and help individuals navigate the social services system. Advocacy and Education: Participate in community education programs to inform the public about homelessness issues and how they can help. Work with local businesses and organizations to secure support (notably in-kind, such as food and clothing) and collaborate on our homeless initiatives. Event Coordination: Assist in organizing and executing events such as donation drives, community meals, and health fairs. Support the planning and logistics of outreach activities and special programs. Data Collection and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of interactions and services provided to homeless individuals. Assist with data collection and reporting to help track the impact of Bright Mind’s homelessness programs. Qualifications Skills and Competencies: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Empathy, patience, and a non-judgmental attitude towards individuals experiencing homelessness. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic work environment. Basic knowledge of social services and resources available for homeless individuals (preferred but not required). Experience: Previous volunteer experience, especially in community outreach or working with vulnerable populations, is preferred but not required. Experience in event coordination, advocacy, or data collection is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in social work, psychology, or a related field is welcomed. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us Please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Session Manager (Adult) for OneInMath chapter at Flower Mound Library - Section 2 - Texas
requirements: 2-3 hours per week once a week

- Bachelor’s degree. 
 Love Math. Love kids. 
 Desire to mentor/coach teens. 
 Age: Adult.
description: We are looking for a responsible adult to manage the OneInMath Chapter at Flower Mound Public Library in Flower Mound, TX. Do you want to be a catalyst and have a long term impact on young kids so they can have a more confident future? Research shows that intervention at young age to build a strong foundation in Math has significant impact in the later years! You will be the adult to manage OneInMath program at this location. You will work with the librarian to actively recruit volunteers to tutor and K-3 students to teach. You will guide and help session leader and tutors to run the OneInMath program. You will ensure that session leader and tutors are following the curriculum, following all the safety rules, are on time, and the class is run efficiently. You will ensure communications with librarians, parents, and volunteers is happening in a timely manner, responsibly, and in professional manner. You will contribute to building a better future community of high school students as session leader, and tutors! OneInMath volunteers develop valuable leadership, negotiation and management skills in a fun environment, and have the satisfaction of helping kids learn math. We provide complete logistics, training, course material, tracker, monitoring and guidance through out the session. RESPONSIBILITIES At OneInMath, we believe every kid should have a chance to succeed in Math! Come, be part of the movement to help kids from Kindergarten to 3rd grade to master basic arithmetic skills, so they are more successful in the future! Learn more at https://oneinmath.com/session-manager/ Note: This position is for Adults only. It is a volunteer position, and NOT a paid position. Please learn more about OneInMath program at https://oneinmath.com. You may want to review Our Philosophy, How It Works, and Parent Q&A for more knowledge on our website.
location: Flower Mound Library 3030 Broadmoor Ln Flower Mound, TX 75022

name: Lead Bushwick Pub Tour for Travelers!
description: HI NYC is looking for volunteers to help lead a Bushwick Pub Tour for travelers staying at the HI NYC hostel. Pub Tours allows our travelers to experience cultural exchange, make friends with people from all over the world and learn more about the local community and culture.  The Bushwick Pub Tour is already built out, so we just need volunteers to train with us and then lead! We are looking for volunteers that can lead once a week or every other week. HI USA is 501(c)(3) non-profit education association. Our purpose is to "inspire a deeper understanding of people places and cultures for a more tolerant world." As a non-profit, the revenues we receive through overnight stays and memberships is reinvested in mission delivery. Select the opportunity from this list https://hiusa.app.neoncrm.com/np/clients/hiusa/projectList.jsp?query.project.id=34 and then click on the Apply button at the bottom of the page.

If you have a desire to make a positive impact in the lives of those experiencing homelessness, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking dedicated and compassionate individuals to join our Street Care team as Senior Manager. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible difference in the lives of those experiencing homelessness. You will work closely with our Community Outreach team to provide support, resources, and advocacy for homeless individuals and families. We have decades of experience providing aid to homeless and highly at risk people, and our program always places safety first. We have a variety of openings, whether you’re interested in going out on the street or looking to help in other ways. Key Responsibilities Direct Support: Engage with homeless individuals and families to assess their needs and provide appropriate support. Distribute essential items such as food, clothing, hygiene products, and blankets. Resource Connection: Connect individuals with local services, including housing, medical care, job training, and mental health support. Provide information about available resources and help individuals navigate the social services system. Advocacy and Education: Participate in community education programs to inform the public about homelessness issues and how they can help. Work with local businesses and organizations to secure support (notably in-kind, such as food and clothing) and collaborate on our homeless initiatives. Event Coordination: Assist in organizing and executing events such as donation drives, community meals, and health fairs. Support the planning and logistics of outreach activities and special programs. Data Collection and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of interactions and services provided to homeless individuals. Assist with data collection and reporting to help track the impact of Bright Mind’s homelessness programs. Qualifications Skills and Competencies: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Empathy, patience, and a non-judgmental attitude towards individuals experiencing homelessness. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic work environment. Basic knowledge of social services and resources available for homeless individuals (preferred but not required). Experience: Previous volunteer experience, especially in community outreach or working with vulnerable populations, is preferred but not required. Experience in event coordination, advocacy, or data collection is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in social work, psychology, or a related field is welcomed. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us Please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Education Volunteer - Indianapolis
description: Join Us in Making a Difference! Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people, and we have been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for passionate and versatile individuals to join our volunteer team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking enthusiastic and dedicated individuals to join our team as Education and Wellness Mentoring Volunteers. In this role, you will support our mission to provide quality educational resources and promote emotional and social wellness in under-served communities. You will work with our Educational Outreach team, in projects such as mentoring people in great need, supporting volunteers, and delivering educational and wellness programs. Key Responsibilities/Projects include: Mentoring Volunteers and at risk populations: Provide crucial support to our in-the-field projects as an on-the-street educator for homeless families and individuals. Mentor volunteers, team leads, and beneficiaries, offering social and emotional support to help them develop resilience and achieve personal goals. Mentor and train volunteers and chapter coordinators, helping them to improve their outreach plus providing them with social and emotional support. Program Delivery: Assist in planning and delivering educational and wellness programs and workshops for individuals of all ages. Facilitate interactive learning activities and engage students in hands-on educational experiences. Educational Material Development: Help create and update educational and wellness materials, including lesson plans, worksheets, and presentations. Collaborate with the Educational Outreach team to ensure materials are culturally relevant, age-appropriate and supportive of emotional well-being. Community Outreach: Participate in community events and outreach efforts to promote educational programs and recruit students. Engage with parents and community members to build support for educational initiatives. Programmatic Support: Assist with scheduling, communications with students, maintaining student and volunteer records, and other operational tasks. Track program outcomes and report on the progress of educational and wellness initiatives. Qualifications: Note: Even if you do not meet all the listed qualifications, we encourage you to apply. We value a diverse set of skills and experiences and believe that passion and commitment are absolutely crucial. Skills and Competencies: Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Passion for education and a commitment to helping students succeed. Patience, empathy, and the ability to work with students from diverse backgrounds. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience: Previous experience in tutoring, teaching, or working with children and youth is preferred but not required. Experience in developing educational or wellness materials is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in education, child development, psychology, or a related field is welcome. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on students’ lives and educational outcomes. Hands-on experience in educational outreach and program delivery. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Networking opportunities with educators, wellness practitioners, and other volunteers in the nonprofit sector. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us For more information, please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Graphic Designer for Social Justice Non Profit in SF Bay Area
requirements: An average of 8-10 hours per week
Graphic design experience to create a booklet, like a small/short version of a magazine.
description: This is a remote opportunity. We are seeking someone with graphic design skills to help develop a small booklet, in the style of a magazine. The booklet would contain written submissions from incarcerated and release persons who speak to their transformation from a violent offender to someone who makes a comittment to a life of non violence and peacekeeping. We'll also include victim/survivor stories, program facilitator experiences, and more. Original art and poety will also be included. Are YOU this person? This is a single project committment, requiring 8-10 hours per week for 2 months. Can be done remotely. Please reach out to learn more.

name: Homelessness Volunteer -  Washington
description: Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and has been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile volunteer to join our team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact in the lives of those experiencing homelessness, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking dedicated and compassionate individuals to join our Street Care team as Senior Manager. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible difference in the lives of those experiencing homelessness. You will work closely with our Community Outreach team to provide support, resources, and advocacy for homeless individuals and families. We have decades of experience providing aid to homeless and highly at risk people, and our program always places safety first. We have a variety of openings, whether you’re interested in going out on the street or looking to help in other ways. Key Responsibilities Direct Support: Engage with homeless individuals and families to assess their needs and provide appropriate support. Distribute essential items such as food, clothing, hygiene products, and blankets. Resource Connection: Connect individuals with local services, including housing, medical care, job training, and mental health support. Provide information about available resources and help individuals navigate the social services system. Advocacy and Education: Participate in community education programs to inform the public about homelessness issues and how they can help. Work with local businesses and organizations to secure support (notably in-kind, such as food and clothing) and collaborate on our homeless initiatives. Event Coordination: Assist in organizing and executing events such as donation drives, community meals, and health fairs. Support the planning and logistics of outreach activities and special programs. Data Collection and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of interactions and services provided to homeless individuals. Assist with data collection and reporting to help track the impact of Bright Mind’s homelessness programs. Qualifications Skills and Competencies: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Empathy, patience, and a non-judgmental attitude towards individuals experiencing homelessness. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic work environment. Basic knowledge of social services and resources available for homeless individuals (preferred but not required). Experience: Previous volunteer experience, especially in community outreach or working with vulnerable populations, is preferred but not required. Experience in event coordination, advocacy, or data collection is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in social work, psychology, or a related field is welcomed. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. name: Education Volunteer - Nashville
description: Join Us in Making a Difference! Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people, and we have been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for passionate and versatile individuals to join our volunteer team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking enthusiastic and dedicated individuals to join our team as Education and Wellness Mentoring Volunteers. In this role, you will support our mission to provide quality educational resources and promote emotional and social wellness in under-served communities. You will work with our Educational Outreach team, in projects such as mentoring people in great need, supporting volunteers, and delivering educational and wellness programs. Key Responsibilities/Projects include: Mentoring Volunteers and at risk populations: Provide crucial support to our in-the-field projects as an on-the-street educator for homeless families and individuals. Mentor volunteers, team leads, and beneficiaries, offering social and emotional support to help them develop resilience and achieve personal goals. Mentor and train volunteers and chapter coordinators, helping them to improve their outreach plus providing them with social and emotional support. Program Delivery: Assist in planning and delivering educational and wellness programs and workshops for individuals of all ages. Facilitate interactive learning activities and engage students in hands-on educational experiences. Educational Material Development: Help create and update educational and wellness materials, including lesson plans, worksheets, and presentations. Collaborate with the Educational Outreach team to ensure materials are culturally relevant, age-appropriate and supportive of emotional well-being. Community Outreach: Participate in community events and outreach efforts to promote educational programs and recruit students. Engage with parents and community members to build support for educational initiatives. Programmatic Support: Assist with scheduling, communications with students, maintaining student and volunteer records, and other operational tasks. Track program outcomes and report on the progress of educational and wellness initiatives. Qualifications: Note: Even if you do not meet all the listed qualifications, we encourage you to apply. We value a diverse set of skills and experiences and believe that passion and commitment are absolutely crucial. Skills and Competencies: Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Passion for education and a commitment to helping students succeed. Patience, empathy, and the ability to work with students from diverse backgrounds. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience: Previous experience in tutoring, teaching, or working with children and youth is preferred but not required. Experience in developing educational or wellness materials is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in education, child development, psychology, or a related field is welcome. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on students’ lives and educational outcomes. Hands-on experience in educational outreach and program delivery. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Networking opportunities with educators, wellness practitioners, and other volunteers in the nonprofit sector. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us For more information, please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Project Director- Nashville
description: Join Us in Making a Difference! Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and 'Street Care'. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and we have been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile individual to join our management team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you! The Pvol will play a key role in supporting the planning, execution, and monitoring of programs. Working closely with program managers, volunteers, and stakeholders, this role is critical for ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and in alignment with our mission. Assist in the development of project plans, including setting timelines, defining deliverables, and coordinating resources. Communicate with project stakeholders, including donors, volunteers, community partners, and beneficiaries, ensuring alignment and timely updates. Prepare and maintain project documentation such as status reports, meeting minutes, and evaluation reports. Ensure compliance with funders' requirements. Recruit, train, and manage volunteers involved in project activities. Help plan and organize project-related events, such as workshops, conferences, or community outreach events. Identify potential risks to project timelines and outcomes, and propose solutions to mitigate issues. Assist with the development and implementation of tools to measure project impact and outcomes. Provide general administrative assistance to project teams, including scheduling meetings, managing communication, and handling logistics. Skills: Strong organizational and time-management skills. Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities. Budget tracking and financial management experience is a plus. Experience working with diverse communities and stakeholders. Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Networking opportunities with professionals and other volunteers in the nonprofit sector. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us For more information, please reach out to us at  info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position,  email your resume to  hrdept@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Bright Mind (https://brightmindenrichment.org/) and Street Care (https://streetcare.us/)

name: Education and wellness mentoring - Antioch CA
description: Join Us in Making a Difference! Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people, and we have been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for passionate and versatile individuals to join our volunteer team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking enthusiastic and dedicated individuals to join our team as Education and Wellness Mentoring Volunteers. In this role, you will support our mission to provide quality educational resources and promote emotional and social wellness in under-served communities. You will work with our Educational Outreach team, in projects such as mentoring people in great need, supporting volunteers, and delivering educational and wellness programs. Key Responsibilities/Projects include: Mentoring Volunteers and at risk populations: Provide crucial support to our in-the-field projects as an on-the-street educator for homeless families and individuals. Mentor volunteers, team leads, and beneficiaries, offering social and emotional support to help them develop resilience and achieve personal goals. Mentor and train volunteers and chapter coordinators, helping them to improve their outreach plus providing them with social and emotional support. Program Delivery: Assist in planning and delivering educational and wellness programs and workshops for individuals of all ages. Facilitate interactive learning activities and engage students in hands-on educational experiences. Educational Material Development: Help create and update educational and wellness materials, including lesson plans, worksheets, and presentations. Collaborate with the Educational Outreach team to ensure materials are culturally relevant, age-appropriate and supportive of emotional well-being. Community Outreach: Participate in community events and outreach efforts to promote educational programs and recruit students. Engage with parents and community members to build support for educational initiatives. Programmatic Support: Assist with scheduling, communications with students, maintaining student and volunteer records, and other operational tasks. Track program outcomes and report on the progress of educational and wellness initiatives. Qualifications: Note: Even if you do not meet all the listed qualifications, we encourage you to apply. We value a diverse set of skills and experiences and believe that passion and commitment are absolutely crucial. Skills and Competencies: Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Passion for education and a commitment to helping students succeed. Patience, empathy, and the ability to work with students from diverse backgrounds. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience: Previous experience in tutoring, teaching, or working with children and youth is preferred but not required. Experience in developing educational or wellness materials is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in education, child development, psychology, or a related field is welcome. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on students’ lives and educational outcomes. Hands-on experience in educational outreach and program delivery. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Networking opportunities with educators, wellness practitioners, and other volunteers in the nonprofit sector. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us For more information, please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Homelessness Volunteer - Antioch CA
description: Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and has been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile volunteer to join our team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact in the lives of those experiencing homelessness, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking dedicated and compassionate individuals to join our Street Care team as Senior Manager. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible difference in the lives of those experiencing homelessness. You will work closely with our Community Outreach team to provide support, resources, and advocacy for homeless individuals and families. We have decades of experience providing aid to homeless and highly at risk people, and our program always places safety first. We have a variety of openings, whether you’re interested in going out on the street or looking to help in other ways. Key Responsibilities Direct Support: Engage with homeless individuals and families to assess their needs and provide appropriate support. Distribute essential items such as food, clothing, hygiene products, and blankets. Resource Connection: Connect individuals with local services, including housing, medical care, job training, and mental health support. Provide information about available resources and help individuals navigate the social services system. Advocacy and Education: Participate in community education programs to inform the public about homelessness issues and how they can help. Work with local businesses and organizations to secure support (notably in-kind, such as food and clothing) and collaborate on our homeless initiatives. Event Coordination: Assist in organizing and executing events such as donation drives, community meals, and health fairs. Support the planning and logistics of outreach activities and special programs. Data Collection and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of interactions and services provided to homeless individuals. Assist with data collection and reporting to help track the impact of Bright Mind’s homelessness programs. Qualifications Skills and Competencies: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Empathy, patience, and a non-judgmental attitude towards individuals experiencing homelessness. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic work environment. Basic knowledge of social services and resources available for homeless individuals (preferred but not required). Experience: Previous volunteer experience, especially in community outreach or working with vulnerable populations, is preferred but not required. Experience in event coordination, advocacy, or data collection is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in social work, psychology, or a related field is welcomed. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us Please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Session Manager (Adult) for OneInMath chapter at Decatur Library - Texas
requirements: 2-3 hours per week once a week

- Bachelor’s degree. 
 Love Math. Love kids. 
 Desire to mentor/coach teens. 
 Age: Adult.
description: We are looking for a responsible adult to manage the OneInMath Chapter at the listed library. Do you want to be a catalyst and have a long term impact on young kids so they can have a more confident future? Research shows that intervention at young age to build a strong foundation in Math has significant impact in the later years! You will be the adult to manage OneInMath program at this location. You will work with the librarian to actively recruit volunteers to tutor and K-3 students to teach. You will guide and help session leader and tutors to run the OneInMath program. You will ensure that session leader and tutors are following the curriculum, following all the safety rules, are on time, and the class is run efficiently. You will ensure communications with librarians, parents, and volunteers is happening in a timely manner, responsibly, and in professional manner. You will contribute to building a better future community of high school students as session leader, and tutors! OneInMath volunteers develop valuable leadership, negotiation and management skills in a fun environment, and have the satisfaction of helping kids learn math. We provide complete logistics, training, course material, tracker, monitoring and guidance through out the session. RESPONSIBILITIES At OneInMath, we believe every kid should have a chance to succeed in Math! Come, be part of the movement to help kids from Kindergarten to 3rd grade to master basic arithmetic skills, so they are more successful in the future! Learn more at https://oneinmath.com/session-manager/ Note: This position is for Adults only. It is a volunteer position, and NOT a paid position. Please learn more about OneInMath program at https://oneinmath.com. You may want to review Our Philosophy, How It Works, and Parent Q&A for more knowledge on our website.
location: Decatur Public Library 1700 S FM 51 Decatur, TX 76234

name: Program Intake Specialist
description: Flexible, approximately 10 hours per week Reports to Programming Director EmpowHERto partners with black and Latina girls and young women from underserved communities between 14-21, empowering them with the necessary tools to thrive and effect positive systemic change. We are seeking a caring, organized, and community-centered Program Intake Specialist to support the onboarding of girls into EmpowHERto’s programs. This person will be one of the first connections the girls and their families have with our organization making it essential that they’re welcoming, clear, and supportive in every interaction. The Program Intake Specialist will manage the intake process from application to program placement, helping young participants navigate enrollment and ensuring a positive, empowering introduction to our programs. EmpowHERto is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

- Bachelor’s degree. 
 Love Math. Love kids. 
 Desire to mentor/coach teens. 
 Age: Adult.
description: We are looking for a responsible adult to manage the OneInMath Chapter at the listed library. Do you want to be a catalyst and have a long term impact on young kids so they can have a more confident future? Research shows that intervention at young age to build a strong foundation in Math has significant impact in the later years! You will be the adult to manage OneInMath program at this location. You will work with the librarian to actively recruit volunteers to tutor and K-3 students to teach. You will guide and help session leader and tutors to run the OneInMath program. You will ensure that session leader and tutors are following the curriculum, following all the safety rules, are on time, and the class is run efficiently. You will ensure communications with librarians, parents, and volunteers is happening in a timely manner, responsibly, and in professional manner. You will contribute to building a better future community of high school students as session leader, and tutors! OneInMath volunteers develop valuable leadership, negotiation and management skills in a fun environment, and have the satisfaction of helping kids learn math. We provide complete logistics, training, course material, tracker, monitoring and guidance through out the session. RESPONSIBILITIES At OneInMath, we believe every kid should have a chance to succeed in Math! Come, be part of the movement to help kids from Kindergarten to 3rd grade to master basic arithmetic skills, so they are more successful in the future! Learn more at https://oneinmath.com/session-manager/ Note: This position is for Adults only. It is a volunteer position, and NOT a paid position. Please learn more about OneInMath program at https://oneinmath.com. You may want to review Our Philosophy, How It Works, and Parent Q&A for more knowledge on our website.
location: Lake Dallas Library 302 S Shady Shores Dr Lake Dallas, TX 75065

name: Volunteer Manager - Columbia
description: Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and has been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile volunteer to join our team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact in the lives of those experiencing homelessness, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking dedicated and compassionate individuals to join our Street Care team as Volunteer Manager. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible difference in the lives of those experiencing homelessness. You will work closely with our Community Outreach team to provide support, resources, and advocacy for homeless individuals and families. We have decades of experience providing aid to homeless and highly at risk people, and our program always places safety first. We have a variety of openings, whether you’re interested in going out on the street or looking to help in other ways. Key Responsibilities Direct Support: Engage with homeless individuals and families to assess their needs and provide appropriate support. Distribute essential items such as food, clothing, hygiene products, and blankets. Resource Connection: Connect individuals with local services, including housing, medical care, job training, and mental health support. Provide information about available resources and help individuals navigate the social services system. Advocacy and Education: Participate in community education programs to inform the public about homelessness issues and how they can help. Work with local businesses and organizations to secure support (notably in-kind, such as food and clothing) and collaborate on our homeless initiatives. Event Coordination: Assist in organizing and executing events such as donation drives, community meals, and health fairs. Support the planning and logistics of outreach activities and special programs. Data Collection and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of interactions and services provided to homeless individuals. Assist with data collection and reporting to help track the impact of Bright Mind’s homelessness programs. Qualifications Skills and Competencies: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Empathy, patience, and a non-judgmental attitude towards individuals experiencing homelessness. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic work environment. Basic knowledge of social services and resources available for homeless individuals (preferred but not required). Experience: Previous volunteer experience, especially in community outreach or working with vulnerable populations, is preferred but not required. Experience in event coordination, advocacy, or data collection is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in social work, psychology, or a related field is welcomed. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us Please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

description: Join Us in Making a Difference! Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people, and we have been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for passionate and versatile individuals to join our volunteer team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking enthusiastic and dedicated individuals to join our team as Education and Wellness Mentoring Volunteers. In this role, you will support our mission to provide quality educational resources and promote emotional and social wellness in under-served communities. You will work with our Educational Outreach team, in projects such as mentoring people in great need, supporting volunteers, and delivering educational and wellness programs. Key Responsibilities/Projects include: Mentoring Volunteers and at risk populations: Provide crucial support to our in-the-field projects as an on-the-street educator for homeless families and individuals. Mentor volunteers, team leads, and beneficiaries, offering social and emotional support to help them develop resilience and achieve personal goals. Mentor and train volunteers and chapter coordinators, helping them to improve their outreach plus providing them with social and emotional support. Program Delivery: Assist in planning and delivering educational and wellness programs and workshops for individuals of all ages. Facilitate interactive learning activities and engage students in hands-on educational experiences. Educational Material Development: Help create and update educational and wellness materials, including lesson plans, worksheets, and presentations. Collaborate with the Educational Outreach team to ensure materials are culturally relevant, age-appropriate and supportive of emotional well-being. Community Outreach: Participate in community events and outreach efforts to promote educational programs and recruit students. Engage with parents and community members to build support for educational initiatives. Programmatic Support: Assist with scheduling, communications with students, maintaining student and volunteer records, and other operational tasks. Track program outcomes and report on the progress of educational and wellness initiatives. Qualifications: Note: Even if you do not meet all the listed qualifications, we encourage you to apply. We value a diverse set of skills and experiences and believe that passion and commitment are absolutely crucial. Skills and Competencies: Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Passion for education and a commitment to helping students succeed. Patience, empathy, and the ability to work with students from diverse backgrounds. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience: Previous experience in tutoring, teaching, or working with children and youth is preferred but not required. Experience in developing educational or wellness materials is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in education, child development, psychology, or a related field is welcome. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on students’ lives and educational outcomes. Hands-on experience in educational outreach and program delivery. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Networking opportunities with educators, wellness practitioners, and other volunteers in the nonprofit sector. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us For more information, please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. name: Homelessness - Waterbury CT
description: Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference. About Us: Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and has been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile volunteer to join our team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact in the lives of those experiencing homelessness, we would love to hear from you! Position Overview Bright Mind is seeking dedicated and compassionate individuals to join our Street Care team as Senior Manager. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible difference in the lives of those experiencing homelessness. You will work closely with our Community Outreach team to provide support, resources, and advocacy for homeless individuals and families. We have decades of experience providing aid to homeless and highly at risk people, and our program always places safety first. We have a variety of openings, whether you’re interested in going out on the street or looking to help in other ways. Key Responsibilities Direct Support: Engage with homeless individuals and families to assess their needs and provide appropriate support. Distribute essential items such as food, clothing, hygiene products, and blankets. Resource Connection: Connect individuals with local services, including housing, medical care, job training, and mental health support. Provide information about available resources and help individuals navigate the social services system. Advocacy and Education: Participate in community education programs to inform the public about homelessness issues and how they can help. Work with local businesses and organizations to secure support (notably in-kind, such as food and clothing) and collaborate on our homeless initiatives. Event Coordination: Assist in organizing and executing events such as donation drives, community meals, and health fairs. Support the planning and logistics of outreach activities and special programs. Data Collection and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of interactions and services provided to homeless individuals. Assist with data collection and reporting to help track the impact of Bright Mind’s homelessness programs. Qualifications Skills and Competencies: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Empathy, patience, and a non-judgmental attitude towards individuals experiencing homelessness. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic work environment. Basic knowledge of social services and resources available for homeless individuals (preferred but not required). Experience: Previous volunteer experience, especially in community outreach or working with vulnerable populations, is preferred but not required. Experience in event coordination, advocacy, or data collection is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in social work, psychology, or a related field is welcomed. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the community. Hands-on experience in community outreach and social services. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us Please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Seniors need people like you to keep their home and their independence
description: Apply to volunteer with us, where you will be connected with a person who needs assistance maintaining their home due to age and/or disability. Our program offers you the chance to use YOUR unique skills to uplift someone in need! We are seeking people to connect with our underserved neighbors and are looking for a wide range of skills, from conversationalists to grocery shoppers to folks who are handy! We would love to hear from YOU! Volunteer Services, a program of Catholic Community Services, assists low-income older adults and adults living with disabilities. Volunteers can provide assistance with light housecleaning, transportation, grocery shopping, home repair, and yard care. With a little help from volunteers, clients can continue to live independently in their homes. Due to the vulnerable population we serve, volunteers must complete an application form, pass a Washington State Patrol check and attend an orientation. For more information about this opportunity or others, Please select the "I Want to Help" button. An email will be sent to you with additional information regarding our program and the application forms. For more information call 206.328.5787 or email vc@ccsww.org.

We value a diverse set of skills and experiences and believe that passion and commitment are absolutely crucial. Skills and Competencies: Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Passion for education and a commitment to helping students succeed. Patience, empathy, and the ability to work with students from diverse backgrounds. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience: Previous experience in tutoring, teaching, or working with children and youth is preferred but not required. Experience in developing educational or wellness materials is a plus. Education: Relevant coursework or training in education, child development, psychology, or a related field is welcome. Benefits Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on students’ lives and educational outcomes. Hands-on experience in educational outreach and program delivery. Professional development and training opportunities. Flexible volunteer schedules to accommodate your availability. Networking opportunities with educators, wellness practitioners, and other volunteers in the nonprofit sector. Note: This is an unpaid position. Contact Us For more information, please reach out to us at info@brightmindenrichment.org. To apply for this position, email your resume to hr@brightmindenrichment.org. Learn more about our initiatives at Street Care (https://streetcare.us/) and Bright Mind ( https://brightmindenrichment.org/). Bright Mind is a federally-recognized 501(c)(3) wellness education non-profit and recipient of awards and certifications in recognition of our achievements.

name: Creative Consultant
organizationName: Carboncopies Foundation for Substrate Independent Minds INC
description: About Carboncopies Foundation The Carboncopies Foundation is an international nonprofit organization dedicated to advancing the science and technology of whole brain emulation-the process of transferring the structure and functions of a brain from its original biological substrate to an engineered computational one. Founded by neuroscientists and technologists, we serve as a nexus for research collaboration, education, and public discourse on the path toward preserving and extending human cognition. Our initiatives span disciplines including neuroscience, computer science, neuroengineering, artificial intelligence, and philosophy. Through workshops, webinars, publications, and community coordination, we bring together researchers, students, and visionaries who share our mission. We believe that whole brain emulation is not only a grand scientific challenge, but a transformative opportunity for the future of human experience and identity. With over 15 years of history in the field, our team continues to foster innovative research and interdisciplinary collaboration. Our projects are powered by a dedicated community of volunteers-over 100 have contributed to date, with more than 30 actively engaged today. We are seeking a Creative Consultant to generate imaginative, compelling ideas for videos, campaigns, storytelling, and other content that communicates our mission and inspires our audiences. This is a concept-driven role: you will develop the creative "seed" that sparks new initiatives and guides our writers, designers, and media producers. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with a talent for storytelling and messaging. You should be able to brainstorm strong ideas for how we present ourselves to the world-whether that’s the framing of a public campaign, the hook for a video explainer, or the core message of a fundraising effort. Develop high-level ideas and creative direction for video scripts, campaigns, and communications Brainstorm and pitch content formats, themes, metaphors, and narratives Contribute to public-facing messaging and outreach materials Collaborate with internal teams to refine ideas and shape execution Offer strategic input on audience engagement and tone Provide guidance on structure, emotional resonance, and conceptual clarity Strong conceptual and storytelling skills Ability to generate ideas that are innovative, mission-aligned, and audience-focused Clear communicator with the ability to express ideas in writing or visual outlines Comfortable collaborating with design, video, and communications teams Familiarity with science communication, nonprofit outreach, or public education is a plus Interest in neuroscience, consciousness, or future-oriented technologies is welcome Flexible, approximately 5-15 hours per week This is a volunteer position Shape the creative voice of a pioneering nonprofit in neurotechnology Collaborate with scientists, engineers, and creatives at the frontier of brain emulation Build a strong portfolio of creative work for a meaningful mission Connect with a dynamic interdisciplinary community Attend Foundation-hosted events and webinars at no cost If our mission resonates with you, we encourage you to get involved. To apply for a volunteer position, please send your resume and a brief statement outlining your interest to onboarding@carboncopies.org with "Creative Consultant" in the subject line. Alternatively, apply through our form at:  https://carboncopies.org/apply The Carboncopies Foundation is committed to diversity and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

name: Become a Senior Companion Volunteer
description: Bring joy, connection, and purpose to someone who needs it most. As a Senior Companion Volunteer, you’ll: Provide friendly conversation and emotional support Escort older adults to medical appointments, the pharmacy, grocery store, and more Assist with simple errands that promote independence Encourage social engagement through activities at Henry Street Settlement’s Older Adult Center and local senior centers

name: Camp Director
description: Is in charge of the seasonal enrichment camps and all child care prospects of our after school tutoring programs and other outside services. Responsible for creating camps, pricing and advertising, a long with registration of campers. Is in charge of creating policies and protocols, further legal documents and paperwork needed for camp. Making sure all daily operational protocols and procedures in the rule book are being followed and obeyed by, by your camp coordinators and staff. Ensuring child and employee safety. Ensuring camp enrichment descriptions and activities are being offered and operating. Running transportation for field trips, and handling finances relating to camp related funds both incoming and outgoing. Making sure all proper registration forms are being administered and being kept up to date and on file. Providing needed supplies and equipments to camp locations on a timely basis. In charge of training incoming staff and making sure such training and education is being used in daily operations. Ensuring American Camping Association rules and regulations. Can also hold Director 3 Position.

name: Special Programs Director
description: We have multiple other programs aside from tutoring that we offer communities in california and citizens world wide. The Special Programs Director will be in charge of making sure our other services we provide that aren’t tutoring are being ran and operated properly. Is in charge of coming up with new programs and or working to improve already in place programs. Ensuring proper trainings are being instructed to staff working within the different departments that such other services run under. Running registrations, approving and filing reports and specific documents a long with ensuring registrants that their services are being provided. Our Special Programs are as follows: Medical Assistance, Homesless Assistance, Peer Counseling, and LGBTQ+ & Transgender Support. New programs are being developed constantly.

name: Lead Educator and Camp Coordinator
description: Is in charge and responsible for the activities and safety of a specific camp location during open hours. Safety going for both children and staff, making administrative decisions for daily difficulties, challenges and choices. Ensuring specific enrichment camps activities are occurring. Going by transportation times and methods, ensuring tickets are being handed out. Making sure proper protocols and laws are being followed. Reporting any needed reports related to safety, behavior, etc... Signing in and out children to their legal guardians. Making sure that all medications are being kept safe, and administering them yourself when prescribed, proper dosage and proper methodology. Assisting your camp counselors with time periods when needed. Throughout the school year your utilizing the same principles but in turn to running an education management site location. Making sure proper education from tutors are being instructed to students. Creating proper communication with other outside organizations and agencies are being conducted.

name: Finance Officer
description: This is a very important job and part of our team. Whomever holds this role is in charge of all financial aspects of this corporation, a long with managing financial funds and information relating to such. Also in charge of managing our POS and sales systems. Assisting in the pricing of our services. Creating records of transactions both by us and paid to us, creating a company budget and handling expenses needing to be paid for by our organization for required supplies, equipment, etc... Handling the 501(c)3 nonprofit status withstanding still, and permanent. Ensuring nonprofit tax free benefits.

name: Special Programs Supervisor
description: Each program is daily operated by a supervisor whom runs the specific program and it’s services from scheduled operational hours. Assists in incoming people seeking to sign up for such programs. Ensuring safety of employees and people attending the program. Reporting incidents needing investigation or further analysis. Making sure staff under your supervision are following protocols and procedures and assisting in running daily activities that your staff run one on one with.

name: Health and Safety Officer
description: Is in charge of creating a safety plan for children, adults and seniors whom are registered and or working for us. Ensuring operating sites are meeting safety standards, and safety management equipment is present at all locations and made easily able for any staff to have access to. Responsible for training other employees through the organization of operating daily activities safely and the need of protection for both us and the students. Makes sure that CPS, CWS, and other abuse reports are being made and written reports that follow are being filed with both law enforcement agencies and our files through the Executive Secretary. And making sure any other safety reports, incident reports, accident reports, etc are filed and followed through with in the proper manner. Regarding children with health issues and needing medications, reviewing med reports and assuring medications are being administered properly and being stored securely.

name: Network Technician
description: Is in charge of maintaining security through all network related technology and software that our employees use on a daily basis. Making sure COPPA laws are being followed and ensuring training and understanding of COPPA laws are maintained throughout the rest of the staff. Handling reports for incidents and issues. Helping staff with technical difficulties through software or programs used through our company. Making sure that student communication with staff and communications through our software and or technology in our education sites and locations are appropriate and safe, if not then handling necessary reports.

description: On October 5, Sprouts Chef Training is hosting our Annual Fundraising Gala - A Taste of Italy - in partnership with The Conservatory. Through an evening of food, cocktails, and impact stories, we’ll raise awareness about our mission to equip youth to rise from hardship through culinary training & job placement, and secure funding to expand our programming in 2026. Volunteers work alongside restaurant hosts and the Sprouts team to support the successful execution of the event through set-up, guest check-in, passing appetizers & drinks, bussing, and event breakdown. This is a great opportunity to gain professional experience, while networking with fellow food-lovers, Michelin starred chefs, and community advocates who are passionate about making a difference! We are also looking for a few volunteers for a smaller gathering on Monday, September 29 th.

name: Gardening and Landscaping Team
description: Volunteers needed for landscaping and gardening, 4-8 hours per week, during weekdays. This position offers a unique opportunity to work with native plants in a designed garden setting. Responsibilities will include watering, weeding, mulching, tree pruning, and planting. We are looking for people with a passion for plants and the outdoors. This position requires bending, stooping, the ability to lift at least 50 pounds, and may demand working from ladders and with power equipment, including a mowing tractor. Be part of our mission of Changing & Saving Lives Through the Power of Aviation. See your work making a positive impact on people's lives. Experience the camaraderie of being a member of the Wings of Hope family, a dedicated group of individuals committed to serving others, supporting each other and having fun along the way!
